Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: reinhardtk
Reviews.Content: Wow. This hotel was beautiful. Well, let me clarify. The lobby and ground floor were nice, and our room (a corner room on the 32 floor) was unbelievable. Glass walls on two sides, views of the bay, huge flat screen, entry foyer, wonderful bed with premium egyptian cotton sheets, desk facing the water with computer set up and free wifi, and enormous marble bathroom with beautiful tub, rainforest shower, tv, and top of the line robes and towels. The housekeeping service was attentive, nonintrusive, and detail-oriented. Illy espresso machine, light dimmers... I could go on and on. As far as other things in the hotel go- we didn't eat at DB Bistro, but we did check it out - very Mad Men styled. The gym was amazing - views over the water, tons of machines, and an overall zen-like atmosphere, surprisingly! A few less than stellar points, however - the pool, while very pretty (and empty every time we went) is not in the direct sun, and is on the 19th floor, so the view from the pool is of the complex across the street. The hot tub was minuscule (but luckily, there was also never anyone ever there!). Also, we were really excited about the basketball court, but the ball court and tennis court are actually the same court, so the hotel either converts it into one or the other. While we were there, it was a tennis court reserved for Sony Ericsson open. Also, parking was $35 a night, plus valet, so factor in a tip every time you want to drop off/pick up your car. These little drawbacks were insignificant, however, compared to the beauty of our room. We biked to South Beach, and it wasn't far at all.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveler72
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in. The workout facilities were also incredible. The staff was friendly and helpful. The 19th floor NBA court, bowling alley and movie theatre were also cool. So was the espresso bar.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdad
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay on the beach in South Beach, but booked last minute, so this was the best option. Very nice, modern hotel. The rooms were very comfortable, good size and state of the art. There was a computer with free wifi in our room. The views were amazing. Took part in the Club level. The service was very good and the breakfasts very nice, although it would have been nice if they had rotated at least one new item each day. The "buffet" was exactly the same every morning. Likewise, the nightly appetizers were a little uninventive and weak. Still, all in all, a good value. The pool was very modern and nice with an excellent view. It was quiet despite being on the 19th floor in the middel of a busy city. Sun was a bit of gamble at the pool as the neighboring buildings would often shadow the pool. There were some other unique offerings by the pool such as a billiards table, a full size indoor basketball court and a virtual bowling alley. All impressive, but all required additional fees which really made them worthless. The casual restaurant on the second floor was OK, nothing to rave about. We did not rent a car because the cost of parking at the hotel was about $30 a night. There was a great water taxi to South Beach available about a 10 minute walk away. The water taxi took about 20 minutes to get to South Beach and was a great boat ride. It cost $40 round trip for two adults. Not too much to do in the downtown in Miami. Not a thriving downtown area like NYC or Boston, for example. Everything is nearer to South Beach. The hotel was an easy walk to Bayfront Park, where there was a great variety of little parks for our 18-month old.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, staff, everything!”
Reviews.Author: Mindfs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is magnificent in every way that matters. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. The bathrooms are lovely with every amenity imaginable. The water pressure is just like home. The concierge lounge was well stocked with a gorgeous view from the 36th floor. The staff were so friendly, professional and great at their jobs. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellerCalgary
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in downtown Miami and the perfect location to spend a night before a cruise. Rooms are very large, well appointed and immaculately clean. The staff were helpful and very friendly. Restuarants were good. We had absolutely no complaints or concerns about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but no sunshine for the pool”
Reviews.Author: Onbusiness1234
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel inside with excellent quality rooms. Staff are very professional and polite. The restaurant is allegedly highly rated but I found the menu limited, lacking in variety and the food quality good but not outstanding. If you go to a Miami hotel wanting a sunny pool, then this is not the one for you. It has an outdoor pool but the tower blocks surrounding it take away the sun between around 9.30am and 4.30pm. It also is in a wind tunnel because of the other buildings. Lobby is dark and unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: donmac20
Reviews.Content: Had this hotel recommended by a friend & was in no way disappointed - probably the best hotel room/suite we've ever had the pleasure of staying in - had mentioned we were coming en route to cayman islands to celebrate our anniversary & the hotel staff definitely took cognizance of this as we were given an upgrade to the most fantastic suite on arrival -huge living room,office,bedroom & bathroom - everything was big! - fantastically comfortable bed,great jacuzzi bath - in a word ,luxurious.Approx.15mins after arrival,we received a delicious chilled bottle of wine & tray of chocolate covered strawberries accompanied by a happy anniversary card - lovely touch. Forgot to mention the incredible views of the bay from practically every corner of our suite ,& the same could be said for the gym & swimming pool .Great to be able to take a dip after an active day - loved the pool area[19th floor].Must mention staff before finishing the review - 'service with a smile' does'nt really do them justice - so friendly & helpful - we've stayed in Miami on three previous visits at Loews,EdenRoc,& Hilton Bentley[all South Beach],all of which were excellent in their own way,but taking an overview of the whole package,the Marquis definitely leaves them trailing. - the Epic must be some hotel if it beats this ! - I've said enough,apart from,God willing,we will so definitely be back.! Oh,go to see 'The Heat' if there's a game on - great to watch & within easy walking distance[20mins].

Reviews.Title: “One night before week long cruise”
Reviews.Author: Minivacatime
Reviews.Content: The hotel was elegant. The room was spacious, and tastefully decorated. The ceiling to floor window overlooked the inlet, and my 2 year old loved watching the yachts and small boats go by. The tv w/i the mirror of the bathroom was great to watch while taking a nice long soak in the tub. The service by the entire staff was exceptional. (I would have given an excellent rating, but the mattress in our room was worn. It actually sagged, and considering the beautiful hotel, and room, and surroundings, needless to say it was surprising, and certainly not acceptable!)

Reviews.Title: “Not a very nice smelling experience”
Reviews.Author: Jefffromtheshore
Reviews.Content: First off I would like to start on a positive note, because the front desk staff were friendly, there is a much-nicer-than-expected bar/restaurant in the lobby, and the location is perfect for conferences downtown. It was quite a bit cheaper than neighboring hotels as well, which is why we booked it. All that said ... my room smelled. Not good. It was a mildewy smell, I think from the air conditioning. The air conditioning left much to be desired. I tossed and turned all night, alternating between feeling a cold breeze and then, when I set it lower, hot and sticky. I didn't sleep well. Not all JW Marriott's fault ... but, when you pay more than $200 for a hotel room, you expect a decent night's sleep, yes?

Reviews.Title: “OMG the "Best location to everything in Biscayne Bay"”
Reviews.Author: vmaag
Reviews.Content: This hotel is remarkable and staff was awesome. Can't tell how welcome my visit was you will have to experiences it 1st hand. Check-in awesome thank you "Jose"....the bellhop was very helpful with luggage and my expresso machine. I have pictures but can't download them on room computer. Beautiful view from the 35th floor....Hotel is close to bayside walking distance...5-10 minute walk....went to Bricknell area for the night it was a blast. 10-15 minute walk....Alot 2 for 1 drinks and food from every taste in the world. Best room & best bed I ever slept in....If you wanna experience Miami stay a couple days before a cruise to get full fun.

Reviews.Title: “If it wan't for the bed it might have been just right”
Reviews.Author: S_foridaBeachbum
Reviews.Content: I feel bad having to give this hotel a medium rating as it had allot of things about it that we liked. The view was spectacular, the rooms really clean and well appointed with plush robes and well stocked refrigerator. For the life of me I can't nderstand why they didn't pay attention the mattress. It was probably the second most uncomfortable bed we have slept in. So soft we literally had to pull ourselves out. It provided for a good laugh but a Terrible night sleep ad a massage the next day

Reviews.Title: “Exceed Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: omegaet
Reviews.Content: We have been and continue to be big fans of the JW Marriott Marquis brand. Now and then, there may be a mild disappointment, but overall, the properties come through with flying colors. While attending the South Beach Wine & Food Festival, we decided to stay overnight in downtown Miami and avoid the congestion of South Ocean Blvd and Collins Ave. On the drive to the hotel, we called ahead and requested a feather-free room on an upper floor. We were rewarded with an upgrade to a corner suite (#2902), providing exceptional space (full bath with a powder room adjacent to the living room, a partitioned office space with a full size desk completed with large monitor and free Internet access, huge wall mounted plasma TV screens in bedroom and living room). The Francis Francis Lily espresso maker in the suite is a nice touch. The floor to ceiling windows provided abundant natural light and opportunities to observe several beautifully populated outdoor swimming pools at adjacent hotels and condominiums....nice touch. The east facing Concierge Lounge offers pleasant breakfast views across the Port of Miami and Biscayne Bay. Three attendants were present during our morning visit and handled the stocking and restocking of the ample food choices (eggs, potatoes, several meats, French toast, cereals, assorted fruits and breads. Lily coffees were offered and upon request, a double espresso ensured a caffeine energized jump start for face a busy day. The swimming pool and deck area as well asthe fitness center were more than adequate and appeared clean and in order during out visit. Flavio Mello, Front Office Manger for the property, and his staff handled the check-in and check-out without a hitch. Others have complained about promptness of valet service....we had no problems, we telephoned about 10 minutes before leaving room and our car was waiting each time we requested.

Reviews.Title: “A MIX Experience !!”
Reviews.Author: enriquedemarchena
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during Presidential weekend. I have a mix experience as I enjoyed the good and suffered the bad and the ugly. The hotel has a great location, the rooms are perfect and the rate that I had via Mastercard was excellent.Breakfast was very good as well as service. The flaws were the following: One entire day the hotel room was not cleaned. When I arrived at night to quickly changed and run to an formal engagement; Voila an unpleasant surprise, room not done.The lady forgot! Every time that I ordered valet parking I have to wait 15-20 minutes and the parking fee was 13% of my rate, simply crazy. Finally, when I paid my invoice they made a mistake and thanks to the fact that I carefully reviewed all of them I was not overcharged with $57.00. I asked at checking out for a bottle of water and the reception didn't have it. An standard in hotels in its category at Brickell. In conclusion, I have a good time but either because it was a busy weekend or because the hotel has to take care of the minor details, it was disappointing that it happens at a JWMarriott

Reviews.Title: “Over night stay”
Reviews.Author: smudgerBradford
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Marriot over night before joining a cruise ship in Fort Lauderdale.This Hotel is very good.The rooms are large with floor to ceiling windows.beautiful king sized beds and a large TV,also a in-room espresso maker adds a nice touch.Would not hesitate staying here longer

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel, wish it were on the beach”
Reviews.Author: cubsfan73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Easy check-in and the rooms are magnificent. Floor to ceiling windows overlooking the bay with a huge tv and spacious bathroom. In-room espresso maker is a nice touch. The gym is well stocked with nice views of the water. Room service is fast with a good variety of items and is actually reasonably priced (for room service). A few hiccups: the valet parking is steep, $35/night. The all-day cafe/bar is on the second floor and without a view, do not the ideal place to grab a post mtg drink. It's about a 15 minute drive to the beach and parts of the surrounding area are, ungentrified. Great place for a business trip or a quick stay. Overall, fantastic hotel with awesome rooms..great place for a business mtg or quick overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel chic The Celtics stayed there”
Reviews.Author: kibabadgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 2101. This hotel is amazing and the view is even better. I booked this for a weekend away alone and I would never stay on South Beach again. I normally stay right on South Beach for entertainment purposes but I decided to do something different this time. The Bayside marketplace is about a 5 minute walk from the hotel and the bus to take you over to South Beach was around the corner. This is was the best time i've had in Miami and the JW Marquis will be my go to hotel everytime I am in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room can improve with logistics”
Reviews.Author: rtybc
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed at the EPIC and wanted to try the JW Mariott. The Mariott is new, with great rooms, excellent service and a wonderful view. However it lost a few points due to some logistical downfalls. the valet parking takes some time to retirve your car, 12-20mins, so call down in advance so they can bring your car around else be prepared to wait. Breakfast service a la carte was slow and just ok. the staff however, was all very helpful and attentive. It was marathon weekend and the hotel was fully booked and the traffic was heavy so this may have accounted for the long waits. for food, elevator and valet. Everything else was great. Overall, I would have to give the EPIC (across the street) one star more.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever!”
Reviews.Author: smercury
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are so spacious and luxurious. And free wi-fi to boot! The bathroom is breathtaking, with cable TV within the mirror, plenty of shelving, a large tub and adjacent glassed-in shower. Everything is new and well-maintained. The room was very quiet. I didn't have a view of anything since the hotel was full, but I wish I was on the other side which has beautiful views of the bay and waterways. There were plenty of hangars in the closet. There is twice a day cleaning crews that go through, although I only got the PM cleaning/turn-down half the time. My only other complaint is that the lighting overall is very dim in the rooms. The pool was nice and quiet, but doesn't get as much sun as the beach because it is perched in the middle of downtown. The meeting space was very nice, and the banquet food was great. I had a Swedish massage at the spa which was excellent. The staff was very friendly. I went to db bistro on the 1st floor for drinks and dinner. It is pricey but the cocktails and the food were impeccable. There are plenty of other restaurants within walking distance, as well as a drugstore. I highly recommend it overall. But be prepared to spend a little $.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: n_bi-coastal
Reviews.Content: We were in for a conference, which had multiple venues. We hated the Sheraton on Miami Beach, which was in poor repair and unbelievably noisy throughout the night so I called Googled other hotels and, since I am a Marriott member, chose the Marquis in Miami. We had a car, so being off the beach wad not an issue. From the receptionist to the bellman, to the restaurant staff, everyone went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. They upgraded us to a gloriously, large, beautifully appointed room, with spectacular view. The furnishings looked as though they had been Installed that day! Spotless. We had no time to use the face,irked such as the pool or basketball court. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: gcbcmgr
Reviews.Content: As a hotel manager myself, I can be very critical, and seldom are all my expectations exceeded as was the case in two stays at this hotel in January. It is understated and at every turn, there is a "Wow", whether it be the incredible views, the impressive facilities (fantastic fitness area, pool, full court basketball, biliards room, bowling(!), spa and great food), in the center of downtown Miami. The room service meal I had was so good, I ordered the same things on my second stay! Conference facilities are magnificent. This is a property that will set the standard for 5 star into the future, and very, very few current hotels can hold a candle to it. Service was discreet and impeccable, there when you needed it, and invisible when you did not. My late checkout and early check in was accomodated without so much as a question, The only negative about the stay was that I could not stay longer..,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel on the expensive side.”
Reviews.Author: DiscriminatingDiva08
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at this hotel to attend the IMG Miami Marathon. The staff was excellent. Valet & check-in we're swift and professional. The same can be said of the great housekeepers and wait staff at the restaurants. Shout out to Melvin, our great waiter, day One. The hotel decor was modern and contemporary. After reading previous Trip Advisor reviews, we requested a high corner, bayside room. Reception made it happen. We had the most amazing room. Floor to ceiling windows with 360 degree views of Biscayne Bay. The beds were divine, so comfortable, like a cloud! Huge flat screen in the main room & a another recessed flat screen tv in the mirror of the luxurious bathroom. I didn't want to leave. Really enjoyed the gym on floor 20. Top knotch equipment with extraordinary views. Nice touches included ice water with lemon, fresh fruit and refrigerated eucalyptus towels. There is a very nice spa, but I just didn't have time to utilize the services. For those in a larger group, the full size basketball court, bowling alley and theatre room were awesome! The area is the only negative. Without my spouse, I would not walk around by myself. Bay front park and shopping were blocks away, but the area seemed on the fringe and not so nice. Area needs to be renovated. I actually think plans are underway. As a South Floridian, I would highly recommend this hotel for the business traveler. It's also perfect for short stays like someone taking a cruise or attending an event like we were doing. Someone unfamiliar with Miami should stick to South Beach, Lincoln Road, Coconut Grove,( and if you know someone), Fisher or Starr Island. This is where the action is. The JW hotel is in the business district.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful six-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Elise S
Reviews.Content: It's a fantastic brand new hotel with lots of amenities. Conveniently located to all major attractions and restaurants. The pool and fitness center was great, and i don't feel any real need to leave the property. We stayed there for 2 nights and was never so sad leaving a hotel. One quick improvement suggestion: the restaurants should provide better value-for-money food, esp. given there're lots of alternative options around.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: NYC10023_88
Reviews.Content: I stayed her last year for work (and then had to extend my stay when my flight was cancelled). I am a Marriot Platinum Elite so the hotel upgraded me to an AMAZING SUITE with 1.5 baths. it was huge. The main bathroom was huge with a large walk in shower. My "living room". The concierge clob has great views and good food. i would stay here all the time if it was not frequently so expensive . .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great basketball court”
Reviews.Author: Biff3ridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference - great conference facilities, great rooms and a fantastic basketball court. Teh conference seating is the best I've ever experienced : a mix of couches, bat tables and desks - awesome. Floor to ceiling windows with fantastic views of the bay. And the Miami Heat (apparently) shoot hoops occasionally on the court.

Reviews.Title: “Too fancy for me”
Reviews.Author: snuffycats
Reviews.Content: This place is really nice. My wife and I felt very intimidated pulling up to the hotel in a rented Toyota Prius. I was fortunate to have found an opening special as we would normally not stay in this type of property. The room was massive and everything was new and perfect. The area felt very safe to me. We were able to walk to Bayside for dinner and felt safe doing so.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: lakeoconee
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Marquis is in downtown Miami. The hotel and staff are excellent. The rooms are large, furnishings are wonderful, bed is very comfortable, bathroom is extremely large with TV in the mirror. You will be blown away when you open the door to your hotel room.You can walk to Bayside (many shops and restaurants) from the hotel along the bay via a walk area. The hotel has 4 restaurants and cafes that are top notch (di Bistro Moderne, Thirty Five Restaurant, Intermezzo Gourmet illy Coffee Bar, and Met Cafe & Bar). I could not believe there was a Bowling Alley, NBA approved Basketball court, a billards room, and Jim Mclean Golf School. They have a top notch spa, fitness center, yoga studio and great pool. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive...”
Reviews.Author: Ziry
Reviews.Content: Perfect downtown location, big chain hotel, sumptuous lobby, restaurant, great amenities (NBA basketball court!), spacious room, amazing decor...Everything brand new! Very good breakfast and helpful professional service.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could give them six stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: spectra
Reviews.Content: I wish I good give them six stars. I stayed at the JW Marriott Marquis the night bfeore my Western Caribbean Cruise in October 2011. Clean, clean, clean and extremely high tech. The pool area left me awe struck. The hotel seemed brand new, the lobby was sparkling. The elevator hasd a large screen television in the wall that had CNBC on it. The staff provided us extra special service since I had just returned from a military deployment and celebrating wedding anniversery. I felt so honored. The bay view corner room was fantastic. The breakfast in the concerige lounge was top-notch, the staff in the lounge, the front desk, the bell staff , and the housekeeping staff were the best I have ever seen. I have stayed at several hotels on 5 different continents and this hotel beats them all. I hope to go back one day!! My wife and I walked to Bayside and the hotels the location convient to many activities. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Reward Yourself at this Marriott”
Reviews.Author: medicalalert
Reviews.Content: Fantastic weekend stay at this relatively new high-end Marriott in downtown Miami. Conveniently located to all downtown venues (restaurants, Port of Miami, arena) but no real need to leave the property unless you're forced to do so. Rooms are huge - those with a Bay View are worth fighting for and the reward is a breathtaking view. Amenities are top-notch, from the unique in-room coffee makers to the television embedded in the bathroom mirror. Bedding is also high-end and very comfortable. Staff is very attentive and accommodating - great attitudes all the way around. I'm already working on finding a reason to return!

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel since a while !”
Reviews.Author: SkippyFrance
Reviews.Content: Whaouuu ! Here is a real JW Marriott place. Maybe one of the best hotel I did since a while, and also the best of all the Marriott hotels I did. Everything was perfect. Beyond the incredible modern and luxurious room (Large plasma TV set, espresso machine, internet PC, etc...), you have a staff which is really helpful and ready to help, valets will recognize you quickly and pay attention as a unique customer. You are in the middle of downtown, you can walk to the famous Bayside market just in 5/10 mn. Place is quiet as all rooms are between 21 and 40 levels. You will have magic views to the surroundings, nights are magic with so many lights thru those full windows ! I enjoyed this place and my family as well. The pool and Jacuzzi at the 20 th level are incredible, fitness room is one the largest I have seen (at the 19th level !) ! You have large rooms, and also a lot space everywhere in the hotel. If you have a loyalty card, stay at the 36 level for the concierge level. Do not miss a stay here !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a WONDERFUL stay at the JW Marriott Marquis in Miami. First the positives: * Good location - several restaurants are walkable or within a short driving distance, but there are also multiple restaurants on-site. It is centrally located to Miami Beach, and other downtown Miami hot spots. * Staff was top-notch - probably the most friendly, polite, and helpful staff in downtown Miami. I cannot say enough good about the staff. The front desk, concierge, cleaning staff, etc., were all excellent. * It's not fair for anyone to expect it, and I'm not sure it would have affected the review, but we were upgraded from a standard room to a beautiful suite (for no reason, just that the hotel wasn't crowded that weekend, and the staff was being nice). * The room was very large and very clean (floor, restroom, bedding, etc., were all very clean). The room was also very quiet. We heard no noise from neighboring rooms, nor from the outside. * Normal rooms contain one large beautiful 52 inch TV - suites contain TWO 52 inch TVs and one smaller TV embedded in the bathroom mirror. Couches and beds are very comfortable. This may not be important to you if vacationing in Miami. But if it's raining, or, if you're exhausted from a long day of touring, the rooms provide a nice, quiet, atmosphere to relax. * The rooms are also very business friendly. In our suite was a computer terminal connected to the internet. No, it is not a full-fledged PC. But, for 90% of the things you need to do while traveling (looking up restaurants, directions, menus, things to do, etc.) web access without bringing your own PC is great. They also have a nice desk working area. Now the negatives: * Note: These negatives are just being really picky, so I really wouldn't put too much weight to them. * There is a small coffee bar with pastries, bagels, etc., that would be great for a small breakfast. It would have been nice if the coffee bar was open a few more hours during the day (especially the morning). Also, my wife craved a Starbucks (like are found in many Marriott hotels). * While the hotel's restaurants were quite good. They were also quite expensive, and the food was not quite up to other high-end, top-notch Miami restaurants. (Note that the ambiance and the service at the restaurants were, once again, excellent). Overall, a great five-star stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: nanciface
Reviews.Content: We recently had a one-night stay-cation at the JW Marriott Marquis as a treat for our 30th anniversary. We live in Miami so we went for one night and also enjoyed a delicious dinner at the DB Bistro downstairs. Our room was on the corner of the 29th floor with beautiful views. The bed was deliciously comfy and we slept great. The bathroom was beautiful with a large soaking tub, separate shower and a TV built into the center of the bathroom mirror. My only complaint, very small, is a lack of bath gel/bubble bath to use in the tub. All in all, it was a beautiful hotel room and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay so far this year”
Reviews.Author: Lisandro T
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is by far the best hotel stay I had this year. I got upgraded to a suite at check-in. Suite room: -The rooms are very luxurious and well taken care of. -3 TVs in room: 2 huge Samsung LEDs (over 65') and 1 tv in the bathroom. -huge bathroom, including a tub and shower. -huge desk with a LCD monitor, phone and internet. -ILLY espresso coffee -Fantastic views Lounge: -There was a lounge on my floor (36th) open 24 hours with TVs, tables, snacks (like 8 different kind of protein or cereal bars), fruits, coffee, water, etc. Gym: -Fantastic gym with all the equipment I needed. Breakfast: -Since I am an elite member, I get free breakfast. The breakfast was FANTASTIC! Cook to order and buffet with some fancy choices like smoked salmon. Service/Personnel: -ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. Very polite and conversational. During my stay, I had a problem with the espresso machine, called the front desk, and within 3 minutes someone was at my room fixing it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shari_10
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, nothing to complain about. It's away from the lively South Beach, but that was OK with us. It was only a short taxi to the cruise terminal, less than $20 for the trip. We were in walking distance to Bayside Marketplace and some other stores. We took the hop-on hop-off bus and spent some time at South Beach. There is a movie viewing room and a video bowling ally at the hotel, that looked like a lot of fun. The service was great, the rooms large. They have a nice cappuccino maker in the room, the best coffee I have ever had in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: francetraveltrekker
Reviews.Content: Just a businessnstay, but the hotel was fantastic. Everything from check-in went extremely well. The rooms are very relaxing, clean and set up for busines with a nice size desk. Ther service was top notch and the stay hardly seemed like work with such comfortable accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best combination of excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: OttoPDX
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best hotel that I have been to. Although the location is not the best in Miami (not too bad though), everything else about this hotel is fantastic. All the staff in the hotel is very polite and helpful. The rooms are the biggest I have ever seen, all equipped with 55" TVs and laptops. The rooms have gourmet coffees, and the restrooms are very chic. The views are astounding. I would stay at this hotel in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - location, not so much”
Reviews.Author: copygirlBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a new and beautiful hotel, with big modern bedrooms and great bathrooms. Huge windows provided spectacular water views. You can't fault the rooms or service, but the location wasn't great for a tourist. There are a couple of shopping malls within about a 15 minute walk, a tour boat operation and some restaurants in the local area - but not much else. The hotel itself has a rooftop pool which is nice and some other recreation facilities such as a basketball court and virtual bowling. However, if the hotel is having a private corporate event, these facilities may not be available. Restaurants were good for both food and service. I am giving the hotel 5 stars because it is beautiful - but as a tourist I would prefer to stay in Miami Beach or South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “miami”
Reviews.Author: kimesha
Reviews.Content: This is the Marriott I wrote a review for .excellent service

Reviews.Title: “Lovely honeymoon night”
Reviews.Author: mumbai_mehdi
Reviews.Content: had a fantastic stay at the Marriott Marquis.the rooms are wonderfully modern and classy yet very cozy. the staff is awesome- attentive and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Raidersh8ter
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many cities for my journey to see all NFL stadiums.. This is by far the best hotel Ive stayed in and was able to sleep very comfortable. The pool is awesome and the NBA size BB court is great too, even it gets shut down sometimes when NBA teams practice or Lebron has a camp. Only bad thing its about a 20 min ride to south beach or the stadium..

Reviews.Title: “Miami trip”
Reviews.Author: travelerJHH
Reviews.Content: This very newhotel is beautiful and well located. The views from the hotel are spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: shaz_aussie39
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before a cruise and couldn't have been happier. We got upgraded on arrival to a huge 2 bed room with views of the water. I would describe the accommodations as very modern and chic. Had a great meal in the bar/restaurant as well, can't comment too much location wise as we just went for one very short walk before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Melody S
Reviews.Content: I love this place everybody was so helpfull and kind, they view the rooms everything was up tp par if you can afford it then go for it, everything you could want is either there or will be there once you call and the beds is the closest I'll get to heaven.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kpaul1285
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to a suit upon arrival was great! the (3) .. yes 3 room suite with 1-1/2 baths (including Huge shower room) was great! Sports bar in the hotel was excellent! Lobby a bit noisy and stark ... but overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott Marquis at the end of October. We were very impressed. We had a corner room on, I think the 31st floor, perhaps 3105. We also had access to the Conceirge Level which I belive was on the 36th floor. The room was the size of a small suite with expansive views of the Biscayne Bay Key and City Scapes. It had a 50+ inch flat screen hdtv and a PC in the room. I am in the market for a new office desk and chair, and wish I could get my hands on the ones they offer in this hotel. They were smart, efficient, and beautiful. The bathrooms are over the top, with marble and thick glass, from head to toe and separate shower and bath tub; and with two marble sinks and embeded HDTV in the mirror--just absolutely beautiful. Conceirge level was first class. The nicest (Marriott) conceirge I have seen in some time. there was a vast assortment of foods / beverages available, and it was plentiful (I have been in conceirge rooms where it's a mad dash to get the small amount of food as it's put out...but, not here). The gentleman who managed the conceirge room during my stay was very courteous, and professional. He had the demeanor of a professional butler. I mean this in the most complementary manner. Everything from the neatness of his uniform to the manner in which he interacted with the guests was really first class. I'm sorry I can't remember his name. I must say that there did not seem to be any liquour available, although I would guess it was available upon request. Parking at this hotel is about $35/day. But, the whole affair is really first class all the way. This is a brand new property, and it shows. The hotel has not had much use. Everything feels fresh and new--just as I like it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: yagators
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for work. It was a great location if you need to be in downtown Miami. The room was spacious and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and willing to help with any questions about local restaurants, etc. The gym at this hotel is great, it has a nice view and a lot of equipment, more than any standard hotel. The bar and restaurant are also nice. Honestly, I can't think of one thing to complain about with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: shoshosho
Reviews.Content: I stayed ta this hote for 5 nights for my conference. I have to sya this hotel is very luxurious with many great ammenities. The TV was large with a lot of channels. A water proof Tv in the bathroom was great add. The bets thing about this hotel was the view. It had a great view of the Bay. The hotel is very spacious with modern furnitures. the bed was extremely comfy. I think this hotel is really 5 star. I am a fequent traveler, and this is probably one of the best hotels I've been to. One negative thing about the hotel is the lobby. I think lobby looks very plain and has no characteristics. Oh, the location of the hotel is poor. It is in the city center, so a lot of wierd people walking around!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: somanynicetrips
Reviews.Content: Large room with beautiful view on the bay. TV in the room and in the bathroom, desk with internet monitor, free fast wifi, comfortable beds, friendly staff at the reception. Location: close to downtown, but still quite some distance to Miami beach (around 20-40 minutes by taxi depending on the traffic).

Reviews.Title: “Total luxury”
Reviews.Author: familyof4travel
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views, top notch rooms, bathroom with TV in mirror, desk with internet monitor. Elevators are only less than 5 rings - some troubles they need to figure out there.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not easily impressed, but was here”
Reviews.Author: gators93
Reviews.Content: I unexpectedly had to stay a weekend in Miami after a week of business. There is a plethera of good hotels to choose from and I decided to treat myself for a couple of days. I considered the obvious: Four Seasons, Mandarin, etc. But I decided this was one of only two JW properties that carries the Marquis designation and I knew is was less than a year old, so I figured it would be there to impress. It was. It is at the southern end of downtown Miami, across the street from the Knight Center, Miami Tower, and easy walking distance to Bayside and walkable to the northern end of Brickell Ave. It could not be more central. It is attached to the new Wells Fargo tower. Both buildings are all glass and marble. The lobby is elegant, but simple. All marble and wood. Reception and check in were simple, quick and efficient. You begin to notice the technology when you are required to get your room key close to a sensor in the elevator to go up. The process is the same for the room door - get the key close, but no swipe or insertion. The room was beautiful. On the east side of the building, on the 34th floor, I had a view of the bay, port and many other buildings. Floor to ceiling glass provided the view. There is a large flat panel tv - I would guess 50 inch on the wall. The desk had a built in computer with internet access and wi-fi was free and blazing fast. The bathroom was all marble, had two sinks, a tub and shower and plenty of other treats, including a second tv in the bathroom mirror that is visible from the shower and tub (But not throne). The mini bar was well stocked and surprisingly affordable ($4 soft drinks, $5-6 beers, etc). I ordered room service both nights I was there. They arrived in 15-20 minutes with a pleasant employee. A burger and two beers ran $32 all in - frankly less than I thought it would be. And it was well prepared. I looked at the exercise and entertainment facilities that take up two entire floors. The weight / exercise room is as good as some cutting edge gyms. It is the best hotel gym I have ever seen. There is also a spa, which I believe has some cost. Additionally there is a pool on 19th floor, a full court indoor basketball court, a virtual bowling ally, billiards, and a golf school, yes inside. I did not try the restaurants. The ground floor French restaurant looked nice, but frankly was above the price point my company would pay. Again, it looked nice though. The hotel bar is on the second floor, which is a bit afar from the lobby. I usually like to have a drink and people watch, but the location is not good for that. Also on the second floor is a nice lobby with fireplace to sit. It was raining one day I was there and the tv lost its signal for quite some time. They use Direct TV. I understand the satellite needs the signal, but it seemed to struggle much more than mine does at home. In summary, it was a real treat to stay here. I would go back - but my budget dictates that it be only for special occassions. Well done, Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: portside123
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Marquis Miami is an outstanding hotel. Upon arrival the service was outstanding. All of the staff I came in contact with was very attentive. I had a bay view room, which had an excellent view. The room was spacious and the bed was amazingly soft and comfortable with a heavy comforter on the bed. The room had a desk, a huge tv and another nice tv in the bathroom mirror with a waterproof remote control. Closet lights turned on when the doors opened. A tv is also in the elevators. The outdoor pool water was cool, i thought it would be warm being that the hotel is in Miami. There is a basketball court for $50 per half hour...tempting to play, but not for $50. Bowling and billiards are available to play, also for a price. I found the price to be good and the hotel clean. The hotel is approx 15-20 min from Miami Airport. I think my total was arounnd $26.00 for the taxi. The hotel is approx 2 miles from the Port of Miami, 5 minutes walking distance to the American Airlines Arena. I would recommend this hotel if you want comfort and a friendly, attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully designed hotel. Excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: Default859
Reviews.Content: Well designed and comfortable hotel. Excellent choice for business traveler. Only complaint was Spa Receptionist presumptuously adding tip to bill without the courtesy of asking whether customer actually wished to add this and amount customer wished to add. (Spa treatment was actually worth it but it was very rude not to have been asked - this practice should be stopped immediately.) The rest of the staff were excellent but review loses 2 stars due to the Spa Receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic would recommend to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: chieftan111111
Reviews.Content: Good service fantastic room stayed on floor 36 with free breakfast on executive floor. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new property within close proximity of Miami fun.”
Reviews.Author: KLfromMCO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. It was very quiet when we visited. The restaurants and common areas were pretty empty. Not what I expected for Miami. I don't know if we visited on an off weekend or if this hotel is still a hidden gem. I like to think we found a hidden gem. The staff was great. We booked a standard room and received a nice upgrade without asking. We were surprised to check into a suite. It had a living room with a desk and computer (free internet). The bedroom and bathroom were spacious. There were TV's in every room. The hotel offered a great rate. Although you have to valet (at $32), I found a breakfast package that covered room, parking and breakfast at little more than just the room. In addition to free internet, they had free water and coffee in the rooms. They also had evening turn-down service. Small amenities, but nice considering that some hotels charge extra for everything. The location was good. We walked to (the very touristy and kinda cheesy) Bayside Marketplace. It was a nice walk along the bay. The hotel was also an easy drive to South Beach. We enjoyed the rooftop pool. Some reviews say you shouldn't stay here JUST for the pool so I wasn't expecting a whole lot, but it was a beautiful pool and it had a spa/hot tub as well. Plus, you can't beat the view from the 19th floor. The pool level also had a basketball court, bowling alley, pool tables and more all available for rent. Might be fun if you were with a wedding party or large group. My only complaint was that there was no poolside drink service. All-in-all, a great hotel. Booking a hotel in Miami is intimidating as they often are not as advertised. But this is clean, well-kept, new, fun and in a good location. Plus, it's reasonably priced. What more could you want?

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: tattoolawyer
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Beautiful room, great service, nice location. Worth the price! If you staying in Miami, stay at the JW, you will not want to leave the room!

Reviews.Title: “We hated to leave, but will definitely return again”
Reviews.Author: NubianMermaid
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott Marquis Miami exceeded ALL my expectations. From the time we stepped into the hotel until we left we were treated like we were the only important guest there. (ofcourse I'm sure all other guest felt the same). Friendly staff was by far a plus. Amaury, our cuban bellhop was an absolute sweetheart with a beautiful accent. He was so welcoming and accomadating when showing us to our room demonstrating how everything works. (the room key activating the power in the room was quite impressive) He was the perfect gentleman. The hotel was amazing. (My highlight was the TV embedded in the bathroom mirror.) Since my friend was going away to South Africa I wanted to upgrade our room. To my surprise when I called the day of check-in to inquire about upgrades, my room was already upgraded to a Bay view. How excited I was.. The view from the room was aaaamazing... Breakfast in 345 was delish as well. Kind of wish the omelette man smiled more. We only stayed the one night but believe you me....We WILL be returning for longer...I was also very much impressed with the valet attendants. My friend dropped a piece of paper on the ground and about 4 or 5 guys dove at it to pick it up for her...My thought: "Shivery is NOT dead"!!! Loved my 1st JW Marriott hotel experience and will return soon!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected and thrilled!”
Reviews.Author: carrieanm
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel for a one night stay due to a canceled flight to DFW. We had no luggage and no where to go. We were so lucky to come across the JW Marriott Marquis in Miami. Wow, what a great room. We actually requested one of their cheaper rooms due to our situation. We just needed a place to rest our heads and then go to the airport the next morning. Front desk had toothbrushes to give us and also gave us a great room with great views. We were so pleased. We arrived at 11pm and ordered dominos pizza. The front desk walked the guy up to our 22nd room to verify he was there to deliver pizza to us. We also ordered a bottle of wine from room service that was there in a flash to open and serve. I will also tell you that our $200 room was sooooo much nicer than our $1000 dollar a night room at Atlantis, the Reef in the Bahamas. It was a welcoming site to have a fantastic room with stuff we had never seen. Im sure for the savvy traveler that a swanky hotel is a standard with all the bells. For us, the Four Seasons is a standard. I have yet to see a four seasons with the a mirror image TV in the bathroom mirror. Fabulous up to date faucets and shower heads, great up to date decor, phone system updated with your name and info, comfy bedding, and the biggest flat screen Ive seen in a hotel room. Bigger than ours at home! it was as big as the width of my driveway to the garage. We really enjoyed our very short visit in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Exceptionally clean.”
Reviews.Author: amancini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just enjoyed a flawless stay at this JW Marriott property. The rooms are clean and well appointed. We didn't hear a sound from neighboring rooms or guests in the hallway. The waterfront view from our thirty-third floor room was spectacular. The mini-bar was well stocked and the in-room espresso maker was a nice touch. Daniel Boulud's restaurant, DB Bistro Moderne, is located at this hotel. It has a great happy hour and Jack the bartender makes a fantastic cocktail. Spend some time here. In regards to location, this Marriott doesn't have much to offer in the area but if I find myself in downtown Miami again, I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again anytime”
Reviews.Author: vlust
Reviews.Content: Hotel is downtown Miami of course on a one-way street, so you will have to be careful and be in the correct lane to turn into the driveway. Nothing much to the lobby is huge clean and nice enough. On the ground floor is a fancy French restaurant very beautiful in the bar area and in the dining area too. Everyone there was very nice and enjoyed telling us everything there is to know about the location. So room- they are very very very nice. Nice and large comfy bed, nice size restroom, the only thing tight was the shower stall. The lights were something new to me. Technology is really advanced when the key to your room controls the lights in the room. I never thought people leave on lights that much, but clearly they must. After our spa services we got in the bed around 5pm and we slept until 9pm that very same night. The hotel was so peaceful, quite clean and very nice views, this made everything perfect for our quick visit. We were only suppose to stay 1 night, but we loved it so much we stayed two. It was a nice change from the South Beach hustle and it was still close enough to go to the beach in a short 10 min ride. I would suggest this hotel to anyone that's looking for a nice place to stay downtown Miami

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ispeaktheblondetruth
Reviews.Content: My husband used Marriott points for our two night stay and we were upgraded to a stunning corner suite. The hotel is cool and contemporary but without feeling stuffy and overdone. Every staff member encountered was incredibly friendly and courteous. Our suite was huge with a generous sized bathroom, second restroom, bedroom, huge lounge area and separate office!!! The views over the bay were stunning (even from the bathroom!) The facilities at the gym rivalled any I have seen and the pool was lovely and usually deserted, in comparison the the pool area at the Epic next door which seemed to be incredibly busy. We ate in the bar twice and the food was great and quite competitive and the barman really friendly. I can't understand some people who leave really nit-picky reviews on this site for no obvious reason, this is a great hotel and I'd recommend it to anyone. We actually came back to Miami after a brief overnight stay in Fort Lauderdale, we came back to the Marriott but stayed in their Beaux Arts part of the hotel which I will review separately.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: abiDc
Reviews.Content: I must say that JW Marriott Marquis exceeded my expectaction. I was in Miami for a mini getaway with with my girlfriends, and we had a blast at the hotel. The hotel is a working distance from the bayside, and about 10mins from miami beach. I have stayed at the Mandarin oriental miami and Ritz Carlton Key Biscayne , but for the quality of service we recieved and price of this hotel, i will defintiely give it a 5 star!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible property!”
Reviews.Author: Steelmuscle
Reviews.Content: This is my first online review ever written. Normally barely have the time to read such reviews no less write them. But having just returned from the JW Marriott Marquis and being so enthralled with the property felt it was time I write my first review. I don't know where to start so in the end I will be brief. I have traveled the world extensively for over 45 years. My favorite resort hotel stateside is the Breakers in Palm Beach and abroad the Viceroy on Anguilla, West Indies. Obviously this is a commercially oriented hotel, not a resort. That said, it is truly five star and very chic in its own Miami way. All staff I encountered were extremely gracious without being over-engraciating as can sometimes be found at Ritz Carlton. The food and beverage option is top notch and prices were surprisingly fair. The health club is world class and equipment there as top of the line as I have seen anwyhere in the world. And finally the accomodations, you could not want for more! This is a hotel I will return to soon, if nor no other reason to just stay in the hotel, soak up the surroundings, food and beverage, without ever leaving for what is outside. I cannot recommend the JW Marriott Marquis highly enough!

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to love it - but it was form over function & service again”
Reviews.Author: MiddleNameGO10019
Reviews.Content: It started well and the property is grand and impressive. On the first day of my three night stay I raced to the hotel between meetings and VIOLA a room was ready at 11:30a. Nice touch, greatly appreciated! The friendly front desk staff upgraded me to a corner unit on a high floor, not at the bargain rate proclaimed by others on this post, but still a very good deal. There's no question that the property is quite lovely - the decor and finishes are visually appealing, high end and aligned with my style preferences. The room is large, the views amazing. The bathroom is huge and I would have liked to have been the granite and stone contractor for this project. The 50+" TV is nice and the work area is up to Marriott standards. My rate came with breakfast buffet each day which was way better than average, in a very pleasant dining room. I also had access to the concierge lounge. Now typically these are not open on the weekends but the Marriott guest services book in the room lists complimentary services for the concierge area and under each category (breakfast, hors d'oeuvres, drinks and snacks) it says DAILY, and lists times. Silly me, I took DAILY to mean EVERY DAY. Apparently not. And when I went up last evening to get a soda, the refrigerators were all but empty. The service staff frustrated me the most. The first night I suffered through what must be one of noisiest HVAC systems going. I thought I was sleeping next to a swamp cooler and nothing I did made the sound abate. The next day I called FOUR TIMES before someone came. That someone didn't speak much English but whips out his temp gun and shows me that it's blowing 55 degrees and that it's all the windows that make it hot and . . . hold on cowboy, uno momento, I'm not HOT, I just can't hear myself think! Turns out too that he was a little chapped, having claimed to have come to the room twice before. I showed him that if he rang the bell, it couldn't be heard over the HVAC unit noise (and I guess he was out sick the day that they illustrated KNOCKING as an alternative means of attracting attention). He did play with the EMS unit and programmed it so it blows less forcefully, but it's still noisy - a disappointment for such a new hotel and for someone like me who values quiet. My specific area of complaint is housekeeping. When I got to the room it was clear that it hadn't been cleaned well - dust, fingerprints and, more telling, t-parts of plastic from clothing price tags in two areas of the room. Always makes me wonder what ELSE hasn't been cleaned. Day two the maid showed up while I was in the room. If she spoke any English I'd be surprised because I couldn't communicate with her at all. She sort of made the bed (this will be relevant later) and cleaned the bathroom and at my request vacuumed in the way maids do - in the center of the room. After she departed I walked into the bath to see that the towels weren't replaced. (Oh, and never mind that my Marriott member profile specifies extra towels for every stay and I've only ever received them once.) I called down and requested towels - finally got them, but without a bath mat (to step out on). Jeez. Last night I was out, and came back to find there had been turn down service. THIS MAID made the bed! Hello, what? To me it would have made sense to make the bed in the morning, and NOT in the evening, but what do I know. Also the dirty glasses still remained and just now, as I'm watching the current maid clean (at 4:05p) I had to ask her to take them as she prepared to walk out of the room. So today . . . it's Saturday but I was in Miami to work. I was out of the room by 7:15a. I turned ON the "make up room now" light and confirmed that the green light was illuminated. I returned at 3:15p thinking I had two hours to relax before having to go out again. But what's this? NO SERVICE. At 3:15p I called downstairs, got a lame answer from AYS which I won't go into here then requested a manager. Flavio apologized and said he'd send someone right up. Someone did show :30 later, and has just left, which gives me an hour to shower, decompress, and get out again. I will check out tomorrow but as much as the property is visually appealing, the room with the view intoxicating, the mark was missed on the things that are important to me and it's unlikely I will stay again. Clean and quiet weren't there, and the illogical room cleaning schedule baffles me. (And don't get me believing someone will actually clean the room within the eight hours from the time I illuminated the button if it isn't really going to happen!) The staff is generally friendly but only the front desk and the concierge really seemed to hit the service deliverable. It's sad to say, however, this is more and more the norm these days and that's a very sad fact in much of America.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms!”
Reviews.Author: smb1007
Reviews.Content: This is a brand new hotel in Miami. I recently stayed with some business colleagues and we all were impressed with the rooms. They are very spacious and well appointed. The fitness center is huge and offers a wide variety of equipment. Overall I was very pleased with the hotel. I'll be in Miami on business i a few weeks and have booked this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PROPERTY, JUST PAINFUL TO GET TO”
Reviews.Author: shttrdrvr
Reviews.Content: Difficult to find the entrance on a bunch of one-way streets. Once you are there, doesn't matter. Entrance as amazing and the rooms was great. I still can't believe the size of the TV in the room. I had a 2 room suite and TV had to be 60+ inches. There even was a tv in the mirror of the bathroom. Most of the food and drink options are right by each other and had great options. JW is very consistant around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for family or business”
Reviews.Author: Maco1
Reviews.Content: We usually stay in the Mandarin Oriental or the intercontinental however after they were both booked out so we stayed here (with two young kids 1 and 9). The room only cost us $104 and the hotel far exceeded our expectations. The rooms are much larger than the mandarin oriental and the intercontinental and the facilities are far superior. It is a new hotel with excellent gym, pool and a lot of other facilities. Large flat screen TV's in room and in the bathroom. The over sized rooms made it extremely comfortable even with a crib in the room. Can pay extra $50 a night to have access to club room where you are provided with breakfast and drinks at any time of the day or night (which was worth it with 4 of us). Highly recommend the hotel especially at the price. We will not be going back to the other hotels while this one is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In the Heart of Miami”
Reviews.Author: tolopez
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the Marquis and had a wonderful time. The hotel is probably one of the newest in the downtown area. Our room (2605) was large and faced the bay. We could see all of Brickell Key, the bay... all the way out to Fisher Island. The room is very modern and spacious. We had a king size bed that was really a king, not a queen they say is a king. The TV was a nice 50 inch plasma. There was plenty of draws and closet space. The room came with a very cool Illy coffee maker, the illy coffee was complementary. The bathroom was very modern with glassed in show, a separate bath tub and a TV built into the mirror. The one thing that bugged me about the room was that it could use a little more lighting. But that is minor. Our stay included breakfast and valet. The breakfast was average but worth it. The valet service is nice but slow. The first time we called about 5 minutes before we went downstairs and ended up waiting for 10 minutes. By the time we left we were calling 20 minutes ahead a time for the car The gym is modern and nice. There is a professional basketball court with the same floor the Miami Heat use. The pool deck is nice, but small. This is not a hotel you go to hang out at the pool. It's very nice but it's not like the pool deck at the Viceroy or the Epic. All in all, we had a great stay and would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel Room and Splendid Service”
Reviews.Author: FrequentlyOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night. However, we will return. The staff was very outgoing, the views were wonderful, the room was decadent and the food in the concierge lounge was second to none. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “No, no , no”
Reviews.Author: blueBuenosAires
Reviews.Content: I can`t believe that after the money I payed, I have such a terrible service ! The otel is beautiful and new, very well located . I always stay at the Epic but as was willing to try this new hotel. My experience was awfull, despite the excellent gym, the views and the decor, the service is the worst I have received in the last months and after the rate I payed this is unnaceptable. I have to say, I paid for a bay view room with concierge level room and in the weekend this service is not provided in the hotel, unbelievable !!! Ashamed of them !

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a room”
Reviews.Author: SheenaNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic room. Upgraded to a bayview and, with floor to ceiling windows, you can really take advantage of the view. Lucky to check in on a night the inhouse wine shop had wine tasting - great start to the trip. Also tried out the virtual bowling in the hotel. The room was just fantastic - best part was the TV imbedded into the bathroom mirror (great idea). Also great to have a PC in the room to use and fantastic coffee machine. Just sad we weren't there long enough to try out the DB bistro - oh well, next time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury with technology”
Reviews.Author: yogimba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here May 30th due to a flight cancellation. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, we were upgraded to a room with a gorgeous view of the water. The room amenities, especially the in room coffee maker and TV in the bathroom mirror. The bed was extremely comfortable and both restaurants were delicious. The in room computer, was beyond my expectations. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Caromape
Reviews.Content: It's amazing... is the best hotel I've seen in my life... is very elegant, very comfortable, very clean ... perfect!!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! LUXURY LUXURY LUXURY. AM I IN DUBAI????”
Reviews.Author: Opcal
Reviews.Content: OUTSTANDING LUXURY. From the full size basketball court to the yoga studio. Great views! BEST BEST Concierge Lounge. 3-D Movie Theater, bowling, billiards, chocolatier, wine shop and restaurants. Exceptional rooms. WOW!!!!! Un-believable. Staff is off the chain for service. Great restaurants on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “What an excellent place!!! Dont stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: I stayed last month in this new property and have nothing but excellent praise for it. First of all, I was able to check in at 8am in the morning which was a real mercy after having flown for 18 hours! Next thing I was upgraded to a one bedroom city view suite. And what a suite!!!! It had a separate hall, dining area with guest toilet. Then a huge bedroom with a super duper luxurious bath including a separate shower stall. The LCD TVs were 52 inches ones! Being a platinum elite member , internet was free and there was a desktop PC for those who didnâ€™t have a laptop with them. Cool! I had also free access to the lounge. The lounge was the only disappointment I faced. It was an excellent place with breathtaking views. The food offerings could have been definitely better probably I am used to the offerings seen in the far east etc. But I really cannot complain at all. Then comes the attitude of the staff. Unbelievable in every aspect. From the doorman to the valet parking staff to the reception and lounge staff- you mention it- all have been trained to provide excellent service. I requested the front desk if I could have breakfast in the restaurant instead of the lounge and the duty manager promptly delivered free breakfast vouchers for me. I have been spoilt thoroughly by the level of service and comfort in this hotel â€“ something not seen too easily in North American hotels. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll Love the JW MMM”
Reviews.Author: cokosmomma
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5-night stay at the JW Marriott Marquis - Miami and boy am I glad the other properties I normally select in MIA were sold out! A beautiful property located Downtown providing a reasonable walk to restaurants, shopping and entertainment. I was here for business and will definitely consider for future visits if the cost isn't prohibitive. As others have stated, the standard room is modern and spacious, and the bed was very comfortable. Floor to ceiling windows provided great light during the day. My room was located on the 34th floor facing the bay so the views were gorgeous. No balcony but not needed. I did not require much assistance from the staff but my interaction with the bellmen, valet, and front desk was always pleasant. I used the gym and the equipment is state of the art with a room for free weights and another room with cardio machines. Not a resort atmosphere (and not adverstised to be) but there's a virtual bowling alley that may appeal to some. My only suggestion to other guests is when entering the guest room be sure to close the door completely behind you. The door is heavy and several times I was certain the door was closed, even heard it "close" behind me, however it would still be ajar. Also I found the lighting in the restroom somewhat dim when applying makeup. My only real complaint is the sink has a slow drain (a pet peeve of mine) but I believe it is due to the sink's style, not plumbing. Overalll, I loved this hotel and will recommend to anyone else looking to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Canada_Turtle
Reviews.Content: This review is written by a business traveler who frequents Hilton and Marriott hotels in North America and around the world. My wife and I stayed here before a cruise that left Miami Harbor. Good: - Very spacious rooms (stayed on points, were given a suite). - All rooms and common areas renovated recently with moden, contemporary decor. - Large 52+" LCD TVs in living room and bedroom. - Interesting TV built into mirror of washroom. - Separate bath, toilet, shower areas with automatic blinds. - Modern work area with desk, chair, Cisco phone, touchscreen computer. - Wired and wireless Internet access. - Good service in the concierge lounge (they must have read the previous poor reviews). - Spacious concierge lounge with refreshments/food rivaling other Marriotts. - Great service (bellhop, front desk, valet and folks getting a cab). - Close proximity to Miami Beach / South Beach by taxi. - Did not try the world-class amenities (gym, pool, etc.) - though other reviewers have reviewed such positively. Room for Improvement: - Slow channel changing on TV's - DirecTV is used as the provider and changing channels seems very slow. - Cost of the rooms - we used points, but cash price would have been $450 - not sure if we would have paid that much given the location. - Downtown location - not something the hotel can change, but the hotel is ideal if you wanted to be downtown, or in an area which was not as hospitable for walking around in the evenings. If you wanted to visit Miami/South Beach...other hotel choices (Marriott brand also) are available much closer to the Beach and in more tourist-friendly areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, wow style hotel.”
Reviews.Author: chef082
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriott for one night on business. The room was very modern, plush and comfortable. The checkin staff and general hotel staff were amazing; always at my side. A hotel manager even closed my cab door and said 'goodbye.' I stayed on the 31st floor; floor to ceiling windows with a great view. Everything in the room worked, always a plus. Only complaint was the bathroom: I was able to hear voices from a connecting room, perhaps beside or above. The noise was not audible from the bedroom so no big deal. Price was high but matched the property and location.

Reviews.Title: “Staff steals from room”
Reviews.Author: specialzk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and rooms are spacious but there are service issues. I had money taken from my bag and when filed a report with Lost Prevention they never got back to me or offered any explanation. My colleagues also had money missing from their rooms as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very large new rooms and fanastic free Wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: disport
Reviews.Content: The rooms are massive and clean with great views. The food in the hotel is great as are the bars. Not much in the area though, dome nice bars close by, but down town Miami is not great for shopping, the Macy's near by dont even bother and lots of beggars in that end of town. Taxi's to South beach were cheap, about $15 and a cab to the airport was just $25.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but service issues”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: Hotel certainly is beautiful, chic, modern and fresh. But too many kinks - perhaps due to it being new. Some staff were great (valet and front desk) but other service issues throughout (especially concierge lounge) would cause be to stick with JW Marriott on Brickell or the newly renovated Marriott Key Biscayne. This hotel is NOT worth the extra $$ mostly due to on-going service issues. Restaurant Moderne was excellent however.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sophia4
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a couple of days on my way to Caribbean. Hotel is new and trendy .Rooms and bathrooms are very nice. Had a problem getting a quiet room the first night, but talked to a manager and got a quiet room the next day. Breakfast buffet was fairly simple but quite good. Had a massage in the hotel spa, which was average. Dined at DB Bistro Moderne twice and it was very good. Also ate in the hotel Sports bar, menu was simple but food was surprisingly good and drinks as well.

Reviews.Title: “extremely disappointed....sizzle but no steak”
Reviews.Author: davis1601
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed in recent visit. Not at all what one expects at a JW Marriott property. Great rooms, plenty of tech - place looked awesome BUT just don't look behind the curtain: Despite the hype of the "Marquis" distinction, my recent experience was astounding due to poor attention to detail and a number of disappointments: 1. most staff, specifically housekeeping, spoke NO English at all - impossible to communicate, for instance, that one wished - as we did - additional towels. On the bright side, did manage to improve my pantomime skills. It is Miami however but the fact the one can't communicate basic guest needs to staff was frustrating. 2. dinner at db Bistro Moderne was a catastrophe - one entree was uneatable, other meals were mediocre at best. And the noise! My God! No exaggeration to say dinner was a shouting match. You'd expect painful din at some two-bit roadhouse but not at a restaurant with the price points this place commands. 3. Finally, to cap the entire "experience" off, upon checking out and waiting for our valeted vehicle (which did seem to take a bit too long - a complaint common by some in our party - but grudgingly acceptable due to the high volume of cars in & out and the gyrations one has to endure to get to the place) only to receive it with the radio at full volume tuned to some local Little Havana station and the A/C blasting HIGH. Clearly unacceptable and in my humble opinion the last straw at a property that purports a higher caliber but fails to deliver same.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ari100
Reviews.Content: I just checked out and already miss it! It is a very beautiful hotel that does not look like a classic Miami hotel: it is more on the classic side, but extremely well appointed. The room (2303)was very spacious, comfortable and classy; bathroom was beautiful; bed extremely comfortable and had plenty of pillows and luxurious beddings ( and since I booked through a travel website and obtained a highly discounted rate, I believe they gave me a standard/basic room). Staff is very polite, courteous and helpful. Food is very good. Gym is well equipped. Pool is nice. Overall I would recommend it to anyvody without reserve. They had some problems with the fire alarm that went off a couple of times during the stay ( also in the middle of the night), but they turned it off within a few seconds and I believe they are working to fix it/find the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Benver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights in this renovated hotel. We were upgraded to a well appointed bay facing room on the 23rd floor that had an amazing view. The service was unbelievably good throughout the stay and the staff went out of the way to be helpful. Daniel Boloud's Bistro Moderne was excellent. Valet parking was steep but is no different at any of the other hotels on Brickell Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms With Average Service”
Reviews.Author: bojislayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way to Key West. We really enjoyed the facility. It was a little difficult to get to, but once we got there we were well satisfied overall. We stayed on the 35th floor facing the harbor, so the views were great - turn off the lights at night and sit back with a bottle of wine with your loved one. Very romantic. The room itself was huge. The king bed was perfect, and there was a 60 inch or so flat screen in the room. Also had a computer in the room, though it was super slow and only allows you to open one browser window at a time - made it kind of a pain to surf sometimes. The bathroom had a separate tub and shower, with two sinks. Lighting was perfect throughout. Had in room Lilly coffee. Have to say it was one of the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in, and we have stayed all over the world from Seoul to Hong Kong, and even Dubai - all in 5 star hotels. The problem is that other than the room, it was not what we have come to expect from a JW, or any other comparable brand of hotel. We are sticklers for good service, and that is why we stay at the JW line of hotels normally. The staff at this place were a little amateurish. The funny thing is that we found there were several international trainees working - and they provided the best service at the hotel. The normal staff were inattentive and not too helpful. Have to say this was the case in the concierge lounge too. However, we had a Thai lady with "Barbara" on her name tag that was great. Kumar in the lounge was awesome too. Other than those 2, we didnt come across any other staff that seemed to care about service. As a disclaimer, we are comparing our treatment here against other JWs we have stayed in throughout the world. So if you are used to being pampered at other JWs, dont expect it here (disclaimer #2 - am Marriott Rewards Gold - got free upgrade to concierge floor, but only after requesting it. Staff that checked me in didnt even realize I was Marriott Gold until I pointed it out to him. Not that this is a big deal, but if you are Marriott Rewards Gold or Platinum, this is one of the perks that usually come automatically - is a bit embarrassing to have to point this out to someone who does this for a living). Had the staff been better overall, would have been a nearly perfect stay. We only ate at the lounge during our stay, and it was for breakfast. We have eaten at over 20 Marriott and JW lounges throughout the U.S. and the world, and have to say this was in the bottom three - not because it was that bad, but because other JWs are that good. The food was ok quality wise. Selection was less than average for a JW. They have evening drinks and canapes, but did not make it to the lounge at that time. Parking is valet only for $38 a day. Bottom line: Awesome place to stay if you are not a stickler for service. I do recommend you stay if you can get a great price. If not, try the Miami Airport Marriott instead. It is actually not too far - get a rate that includes breakfast buffet (or for those of us that are Gold or Platinum - its included (not sure about Silver?)) - you will not be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with potential to become great”
Reviews.Author: SpaGirl007
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Miami for a nice break from the cold and snow. Overall I had a good experience at the JW Marriott and the hotel has the potential to be great. Pros: The hotel is beautiful...very modern design with all the amenities that you would expect from a luxury hotel. If you're in town on business it's a good location..away from the party scene of South Beach but a short ride away. Overall service is pleasant and attentive DB Moderne restaurant was excellent Cons: The service is not quite up to the standard of a luxury hotel. It's good but not great so there is plenty of room for improvement. The concierge and other staff should have a better idea of things to do in the area. For example, the concierge sent me to the Design Center area for shopping on Saturday and most of the stores were closed. This is something a well trained concierge should know. Since the hotel is new, the hours of operation for the Wine Boutique and chocolate shop were inconsistent. The spa/fitness center did not have classes/yoga over the weekend so I ended up going across the street to Exhale Spa located at Epic Hotel (very nice)! Hopefully this will change as business picks up. Overall I would recommend for business travelers.
